intro: Macropteranthes, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
